intro: Rhodamnia trinervia var. nivea, commonly known as the white-flowered rhodamnia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
